meanings.definition: Relating to or dealing with the ultimate destiny of humanity or the world.
meanings.sent1: The eschatologically theories about the end of the world fascinated the students in the class.
meanings.sent2: The book discussed the eschatologically beliefs of different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The eschatologically prediction of the world ending on a Friday made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her eschatologically view of life painted a picture of hope and renewal.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed an eschatologically future where humanity had evolved into a peaceful society.

meanings.definition: In a manner pertaining to the study of the end times or the final events in history.
meanings.sent1: The professor spoke eschatologically about the apocalypse in his lecture.
meanings.sent2: The group eschatologically analyzed the prophecies in ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would eschatologically finish her work right before the deadline.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor reported the events of the day eschatologically, as if they were leading to a grand finale.
meanings.sent5: The storm approached eschatologically, with dark clouds and strong winds foretelling its arrival.
